meanings.definition: A nocturnal bird of the oilbird family, found in caves in South America.
meanings.sent1: The guacharo chirped softly in the dark cave.
meanings.sent2: I heard the guacharo's call echoing through the cave at night.
meanings.sent3: The guacharo decided to take a nap during the day and explore the cave at night.
meanings.sent4: Her singing voice was like a guacharo's call, haunting and beautiful.
meanings.sent5: The guacharo's wings fluttered silently as it soared through the cave.

meanings.definition: A person who is foolish or easily deceived.
meanings.sent1: Don't be a guacharo and fall for that trick again.
meanings.sent2: He felt like a guacharo when he realized he had been fooled.
meanings.sent3: The guacharo believed the fake treasure map was real and went on a wild goose chase.
meanings.sent4: She felt like a guacharo in a world full of cunning foxes.
meanings.sent5: Being a guacharo in this situation will only lead to trouble.
